page.title: 02Essex coastal area ecology
page.content: This area, which comprises saltmarsh, sea and sand-dunes is teeming with wildlife of all sorts. Those who study ecology find a great deal to interest them along this sea shore. The saltings are a fine natural haven for saline wildlife being fairly inaccessible to human interference. There are many varieties of plants both in and near the sea. Rock sea-lavender, sea-spurrey, marram grass, samphire, are but a few and the masses of seaweed and other oddments cast up by the tide form a li,ited habitat. This provides sustenance for clouds of sand-hoppers and for beetles, flies and small worms. The shore and sand-dune area provide nesting & feeding sites for the little tern & waders, notably oystercatchers, & ringed plovers.Colchester Museum has a complete list of all species sited.
